sect2.title: Introduction to Avifile
sect2.para: The Avifile package contains an AVI video file player, tools and support libraries. This is useful for viewing and editing AVI files.

sect2.title: Installation of Avifile
sect2.para: Install Avifile by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../avifile-&avifile-version;-gcc34-1.patch && patch -Np1 -i ../avifile-&avifile-version;-gcc34_ffmpeg-1.patch && patch -Np1 -i ../avifile-&avifile-version;-freetype_fix-1.patch && install -d /usr/lib/avifile-0.7/win32 && tar xzvf ../binaries-011002.tgz -C /usr/lib/avifile-0.7 && ./autogen.sh && ./configure && make maintainer-clean && ./autogen.sh && ./configure --prefix=/usr \ --with-win32-path=/usr/lib/avifile-0.7/win32 && make && make install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: ./autogen.sh && ./configure && make maintainer-clean && ./autogen.sh: The author of this package used the old autoconf which leads to problems like configure not being able to detect some libraries and compilation errors. This is fixed by rebuilding the configuration scripts.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Avifile package contains aviplay, avibench, avifile-config, mmxnow-config, avirecompress, avicap, avirec, kv4lsetup, avicat, avitype and avimake.

sect3.title: aviplay
sect3.para: aviplay manages the input formats, the CODECs and the output formats to display AVI video files on your screen.

sect3.title: avibench
sect3.para: avibench performs a measurement of the AVI file support library's performance for a file.

sect3.title: avifile-config
sect3.para: avifile-config is run by configure for programs wishing to link to the Avifile library.

sect3.title: mmxnow-config
sect3.para: mmxnow-config is run by configure for programs wishing to link to the mmxnow library.

sect3.title: avirecompress
sect3.para: avirecompress is a widget that takes an input file of one CODEC type and converts it into a video file of another CODEC.

sect3.title: avicap
sect3.para: avicap is a widget that displays acquired video from a Video For Windows (VFW) compatible device, like a webcam or a TV-tuner.

sect3.title: avirec
sect3.para: avirec is a command-line video recording tool.

sect3.title: kv4lsetup
sect3.para: kv4lsetup is a small tool which tells video4linux about the current video mode.

sect3.title: avicat
sect3.para: avicat takes a set of AVI files and combines them into a single file.

sect3.title: avitype
sect3.para: avitype will read and display AVI file header information.

sect3.title: avimake
sect3.para: avimake takes a set of JPG images and creates a movie.
